meanings.definition: The act of entrapping or the state of being entrapped.
meanings.sent1: The entrapments of the spider web caught the fly.
meanings.sent2: The hiker was cautious of potential entrapments in the dense forest.
meanings.sent3: The entrapments of the maze made the mouse scratch its head in confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her entrapments in the legal system felt like a never-ending nightmare.
meanings.sent5: The entrapments of quicksand can be terrifying and dangerous.

meanings.definition: Something that entraps, such as a snare or trap.
meanings.sent1: The hunter set up entrapments to catch wild animals.
meanings.sent2: The detective carefully examined the entrapments left by the criminal.
meanings.sent3: The entrapments in the haunted house were surprisingly effective.
meanings.sent4: His charming smile was an entrapment that lured many into his schemes.
meanings.sent5: The entrapments of the escape room challenged the participants' problem-solving skills.
